content:
• Tuesday, January 17, 2012
  • HTZ

    Hertz (NYSE:HTZ) says it's acquired the remaining 35% stake in Navigation Solutions, the...

    Hertz (NYSE:HTZ) says it's acquired the remaining 35% stake in Navigation Solutions, the operational arm of its NeverLost customized, in car GPS system, from Thales Navigation. Navigation Solutions will become a wholly-owned subsidiary of The Hertz Corporation. Shares +1.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 PM
  • TESS

    Tessco (NASDAQ:TESS) FQ3 earnings beat estimates across the board on a surge in retail sales,...

    Tessco (NASDAQ:TESS) FQ3 earnings beat estimates across the board on a surge in retail sales, reporting an EPS of $0.59 compared to $0.38 in the prior year period. Revenue rose by 35% to $226M compared to last year's $148M. Gross profit grew by 17% to $39.5M, and operating margin improved to 3.5% from 2.6%. Shares +2.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM
  • XOMA

    Drug maker XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA) says it's acquired the U.S. rights to market an Ace Inhibitor...

    Drug maker XOMA (NASDAQ:XOMA) says it's acquired the U.S. rights to market an Ace Inhibitor blood-pressure treatment franchise from its European partner, French pharmaceutical company Les Laboratoires Servier. Shares +7.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM
  • ERF

    Canadian oil & gas producer Enerplus (NYSE:ERF) falls 1.6% AH after announcing a 12.79M...

    Canadian oil & gas producer Enerplus (NYSE:ERF) falls 1.6% AH after announcing a 12.79M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $303M based on today's close. Enerplus says it will use the proceeds to help finance its 2012 capex, which includes $800M worth of spending on exploration & development projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • LLTC

    More on Linear Technology's (NASDAQ:LLTC) FQ1 report: Though FQ1 EPS missed, the analog...

    More on Linear Technology's (NASDAQ:LLTC) FQ1 report: Though FQ1 EPS missed, the analog chipmaker is guiding for FQ2 revenue growth of 4%-8% Q/Q, above a consensus for a 3% increase. As a result, Linear shares are now up 8% AH. Rising in sympathy: MXIM +2.1%. ADI +2.2%. TXN +2.2%. FCS +2.3%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • PTE

    Video game developer Majesco Entertainment (COOL) falls 14.4% AH after reporting FQ4 (ended Oct....

    Video game developer Majesco Entertainment (COOL) falls 14.4% AH after reporting FQ4 (ended Oct. 31) revenue of $25.1M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.07, missing consensus by $1.9M and $0.11. Majesco is also guiding for FY12 (ends Oct. 2012) of $125M-$140M and EPS of $0.25-$0.35, below a consensus of $141.5M and $0.46. NPD recently reported that U.S. retail video game sales were soft in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • LLTC

    Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): FQ1 EPS of $0.38 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $294.33M (-23%...

    Linear Technology (NASDAQ:LLTC): FQ1 EPS of $0.38 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $294.33M (-23% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • CE

    Chemical maker Celanese (NYSE:CE) drops 3.2% AH after warning it expects 2011 EPS of $4.45,...

    Chemical maker Celanese (NYSE:CE) drops 3.2% AH after warning it expects 2011 EPS of $4.45, below a consensus of $4.71. The company blames weak macro conditions, particularly in Europe, for the shortfall. However, Celanese says it's "experiencing improved order patterns" this quarter, and expects its 2012 EPS to exceed a consensus forecast of $4.70.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) announces Jerry Yang's resignation from its board and all other positions with the...

    Yahoo (YHOO) announces Jerry Yang's resignation from its board and all other positions with the company, effective immediately. Yang also resigns from the boards of Yahoo Japan and Alibaba. YHOO +4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 6 Comments
  • NGLS

    Midstream natural gas firm Targa Resources (NYSE:NGLS) falls 3.4% AH after announces a 4M share...

    Midstream natural gas firm Targa Resources (NYSE:NGLS) falls 3.4% AH after announces a 4M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $158.3M as of today's close. Targa plans to use the proceeds to reduce its credit facility borrowings, and for "general partnership purchases."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • PMCS

    Telecom chipmaker PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS) rises 3.3% AH after activist money manager Relational...

    Telecom chipmaker PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS) rises 3.3% AH after activist money manager Relational Investors discloses it has a 7.17% stake in the company, and asserts PMC's board "may need to consider broader strategic alternatives." PMC's growth has been held back in recent years by its exposure to legacy technologies such as T1/T3 lines, ATM switches, and SONET optical gear.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • CREE

    More on Cree's FQ2 report: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $290M-$310M and EPS of...

    More on Cree's FQ2 report: The company expects FQ3 revenue of $290M-$310M and EPS of $0.18-$0.25, below a consensus of $321.4M and $0.30. Its gross margin was 35.3%, down 210 bps Q/Q and 1240 bps Y/Y. SG&A expenses rose 47% Y/Y (boosted by the Rund acquisition), far outpacing revenue growth of 18%. CREE -4.9% AH. Also lower: AIXG -0.9%. VECO -2.2%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • BXS

    BancorpSouth (NYSE:BXS): Q4 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $173.12M Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)

    BancorpSouth (NYSE:BXS): Q4 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $173.12M Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CREE

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ2 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $304.1M (+18% Y/Y) misses by...

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ2 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $304.1M (+18% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • AET

    Health insurer Coventry (CVH +2.4%) forecasts 10%-12% gains in Medicare Advantage membership...

    Health insurer Coventry (CVH +2.4%) forecasts 10%-12% gains in Medicare Advantage membership this month, while Medicare Part D membership is seen rising 23%-25%. As such, Coventry expects to add more than $1.7B in new revenue this year, or ~14% gain, while earnings growth is seen beyond the upper end of the company's range.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • VALE

    Brazilian miner Vale (VALE +5.4%) gets a boost after saying yesterday that it's proposing a $6B...

    Brazilian miner Vale (VALE +5.4%) gets a boost after saying yesterday that it's proposing a $6B dividend payment for 2012, which is a 50% increase from 2011. Iron ore prices will remain key as to whether it will be able to follow through however, as ongoing political and tax uncertainty in Brazil continues to depress valuations and weigh on its share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • CI

    Cigna (CI +2.5%) moves higher after announcing a JV with Indian conglomerate TTK Group to sell...

    Cigna (CI +2.5%) moves higher after announcing a JV with Indian conglomerate TTK Group to sell health insurance products across India. Pending approval by India's regulatory authorities, Cigna TTK is expected to begin operations in early 2013 and will build its workforce locally.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • SEE

    Sealed Air (SEE +5%) is trading higher today after its board elected private investor Richard L....

    Sealed Air (SEE +5%) is trading higher today after its board elected private investor Richard L. Wambold to its board of directors as an independent director, effective in March, 2012. Wambold also serves as director of Cooper Tire and Rubber (CTB -3%) and Castparts (PCP +1.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • HOGS

    Zhongpin (HOGS +5.4%) trades higher today after being upgraded to Buy at Maxim, citing an...

    Zhongpin (HOGS +5.4%) trades higher today after being upgraded to Buy at Maxim, citing an improving macro environment and stabilizing margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • SHLDQ

    Skeptical of rumors that PE firms might take Sears (SHLD +8.2%) private, Imperial Capital's Mary...

    Skeptical of rumors that PE firms might take Sears (SHLD +8.2%) private, Imperial Capital's Mary Ross Gilbert tells CNBC the retailer has bigger issues that could make a going-private transaction impossible, "including significant cash burn with rapidly deteriorating financial performance and reduced liquidity, particularly if the major vendors become reluctant to fund holiday 2012 shipments."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 12 Comments
  • LYV

    Live Nation Entertainment (LYV -1.3%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cuts the shares to Hold on...

    Live Nation Entertainment (LYV -1.3%) dips after Stifel Nicolaus cuts the shares to Hold on valuation. The firm adds that with no change in operating fundamentals the stock appears to be at full value, and while it does see growth in 2012, it will liekly be more muted.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • BAM

    Brookfield Asset Management (BAM +2.8%) cancels a deal to take control of the huge Atlantis...

    Brookfield Asset Management (BAM +2.8%) cancels a deal to take control of the huge Atlantis resort in the Bahamas and two other resorts from Kerzner International Holdings after other creditors obtained a court ruling delaying the deal. Brookfield had reached a deal for Kerzner to consensually forfeit the properties to BAM.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • LOGI

    Logitech (LOGI -2.3%) sells off thanks to a downgrade to Underweight from JPMorgan's Paul...

    Logitech (LOGI -2.3%) sells off thanks to a downgrade to Underweight from JPMorgan's Paul Coster, who thinks the "strong offerings" displayed by rivals at CES suggest market share losses are on the way. In particular, he thinks "lifestyle branded peripherals and accessories" from the likes of Skullcandy (NASDAQ:SKUL) and Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) are a major threat to Logitech.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • AGCO

    Morgan Stanley opens up a 60-day tactical idea on Agco (AGCO +1.5%), saying it sees a falloff in...

    Morgan Stanley opens up a 60-day tactical idea on Agco (AGCO +1.5%), saying it sees a falloff in share price over the next two months. Analysts with the firm discount the chance that the company will be snapped up in a takeover and forecast the high supply of corn in the market will pressure Agco's margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • CPRI

    High-end apparel designer Michael Kors (KORS +5.4%), which soared last month following its IPO,...

    High-end apparel designer Michael Kors (KORS +5.4%), which soared last month following its IPO, is rallying today thanks to bullish comments from ISI Group. The firm says its checks indicate Michael Kors "had a strong holiday season," and that leads it to think there could be upside to its FQ3 EPS estimate of $0.10.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • KVPBQ

    Shares of K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A +16.9%) soar after rival Columbia Laboratories' preterm birth...

    Shares of K-V Pharmaceutical (KV.A +16.9%) soar after rival Columbia Laboratories' preterm birth gel is deemed "not effective" by the FDA. Also showing some action related to the news is Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -2.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • CAT

    Heavy equipment manufacturers rise on the back of China's upbeat GDP data: Caterpillar (CAT...

    Heavy equipment manufacturers rise on the back of China's upbeat GDP data: Caterpillar (CAT +1.5%), Deere (DE +1%) and Manitowoc (MTW +3.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell (LYB +1.3%) ticks higher after Goldman upped the shares to Buy earlier today,...

    LyondellBasell (LYB +1.3%) ticks higher after Goldman upped the shares to Buy earlier today, saying that restocking coupled with industry outages in H1 will drive ethylene prices higher in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • JNP

    Trading Columbia Labs (CBRX -22.9%) is halted as word spreads that the FDA has said that the...

    Trading Columbia Labs (CBRX -22.9%) is halted as word spreads that the FDA has said that the firm's preterm birth gel isn't effective. Shares were in a dizzying freefall before the halt kicked in.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM
  • WAT

    Waters (WAT +2.4%) moves higher after announcing it's selected The Tecan Group, a provider of...

    Waters (WAT +2.4%) moves higher after announcing it's selected The Tecan Group, a provider of laboratory instruments and solutions, to supply instruments for the sample preparation of its clinical laboratory assays using Tecan's Freedom EVO liquid handling solution. The platform will improve testing efficiencies by automating the company's routine clinical laboratory assays.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE +4.2%) is trading higher ahead of today's FQ2 report. Possibly helping is a bullish...

    Cree (CREE +4.2%) is trading higher ahead of today's FQ2 report. Possibly helping is a bullish note from Goldman, which claims stable pricing and better-than-expected outdoor lighting penetration will buoy near-term results. Siemens blamed a round of job cuts announced today on growing LED lighting demand. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • RCL

    Barclays tells clients to buy shares of Royal Caribbean (RCL -5.3%) on weakness tied to the...

    Barclays tells clients to buy shares of Royal Caribbean (RCL -5.3%) on weakness tied to the disaster with rival Carnival's cruise ship. Analyst Felicia Kantor Hendrix points to the sector's strong start to the 2012 wave season, and calls any dip in bookings only "temporary."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • LGF.A

    Not everyone is impressed with Lions Gate's (LGF +4.3%) planned combination with Summit. Caris...

    Not everyone is impressed with Lions Gate's (LGF +4.3%) planned combination with Summit. Caris notes that 59% of the $412M purchase price "will be sourced from cash on Summit’s own balance sheet... We question the timing and strategic validity of the deal since there is only one more Twilight film left in the series, and Summit’s track record outside of the Twilight franchise is mediocre at best.”
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +8%) spikes higher following the release of NPD data estimating...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +8%) spikes higher following the release of NPD data estimating Keurig brewer sales rose 50% Y/Y in December - well above the 30% growth forecast by SunTrust. Green Mountain, which had 24.6% of its float shorted as of Dec. 30, reports earnings on Feb. 1. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF +4.2%), which announced its expected acquisition of Summit Entertainment Friday...

    Lions Gate (LGF +4.2%), which announced its expected acquisition of Summit Entertainment Friday afternoon, is rising today thanks to an NY Post report claiming the studio is planning to sell its stake in TV Guide Network, and is already in talks with several P-E firms. Nielsen estimates the TV channel lost 20% of its viewers in 2011.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • WYNN

    Gaming stocks, which often swing on news out of China because of the heavy investments U.S....

    Gaming stocks, which often swing on news out of China because of the heavy investments U.S. firms have made in Macau casinos, move up after China's GDP continues to show brisk growth and Macau gaming revenue rose 4.7% Q/Q. Wynn Resorts (WYNN +5.2%) also enjoys an upgrade from Susquehanna. LVS +1.4%, MGM +1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods (WFM +3.7%) is outperforming thanks to an upgrade to Buy from Cleveland Research;...

    Whole Foods (WFM +3.7%) is outperforming thanks to an upgrade to Buy from Cleveland Research; the firm's checks (like Jefferies' recent checks) indicate a strong holiday season and improving trends. Meanwhile, Matt Andrejczak is singing the praises of co-CEOs John Mackey and Walter Robb, noting their efforts to make Whole Foods' offerings more price-competitive.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (AMAT +3.2%) leads semiconductor stocks (SOXX +1.1%) higher after...

    Applied Materials (AMAT +3.2%) leads semiconductor stocks (SOXX +1.1%) higher after RBC Capital raises its rating and price target on the tech titan, saying it is "well-positioned to outperform semicap stocks in 2012.” RBC believes lagging shares have bottomed, adding that AMAT is in a strong position in the face of a "challenging" business environment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN +6.6%) jumps after Jefferies (Buy) says it has learned the company would prefer...

    Amarin (AMRN +6.6%) jumps after Jefferies (Buy) says it has learned the company would prefer either to sell itself, or commercialize its AMR101 drug on its own, than to enter into a royalty-bearing partnership for AMR101. Management is said to be concerned about the challenges involved in negotiating a partnership.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6.2%) shares spike on heavy volume due to a report detailing Samsung's...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6.2%) shares spike on heavy volume due to a report detailing Samsung's (OTC:SSNLF) possible interest in the company. "One of the biggest assets RIM has is BlackBerry Messenger, and it would be a smart way for Samsung to differentiate itself inside the Android ecosystem," BGR.com speculates. "Jim [Balsillie] is going hard after Samsung."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • SINA

    Contributing to Sina's (SINA +3.3%) gains today may be a report from a government think tank...

    Contributing to Sina's (SINA +3.3%) gains today may be a report from a government think tank claiming the number of registered users for Sina's Weibo microblogging platform rose 296% in 2011, to 249.9M - a figure that represents nearly half of China's estimated 513M Internet users. Weibo, which has occasionally raised the ire of regulators, was estimated to have 250M users as of November.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • FRO

    Frontier (FRO +5.9%) shares bounce after contracts used to bet on the cost of shipping oil...

    Frontier (FRO +5.9%) shares bounce after contracts used to bet on the cost of shipping oil yesterday advanced the most since Sept. 1; a glut of supertankers competing to load cargoes of Persian Gulf oil shrank to a 14-month low. Demand for crude before China's Lunar New Year holidays starting Jan. 23 may be helping to lift charter rates, a Frontline exec says.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • ITW

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW +4.1%), which has been facing pressure to break up, is one of the...

    Illinois Tool Works (ITW +4.1%), which has been facing pressure to break up, is one of the S&P 500's top gainers following its decision to give shareholder Relational Investors a board seat. In return, Relational will refrain from launching a proxy contest to gain a directorship and initiate or encourage any stockholder proposals.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • FCX

    Copper stocks gain on the back of a 2.3% upside move in the metal after China's...

    Copper stocks gain on the back of a 2.3% upside move in the metal after China's better-than-anticipated Q4 GDP data yesterday: Freeport McMoRan Copper & Gold (FCX +1.8%), Southern Copper (SCCO +2.1%), Takeko Mines (TGB +3.3%), HudBay Minerals (HBM +5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NEM -2.4%) foresees copper production over the next year to fall short of...

    Newmont Mining (NEM -2.4%) foresees copper production over the next year to fall short of estimated 2011 levels, while also predicting higher costs for metals sales. The world's second-biggest gold producer after Barrick Gold (ABX) also predicts gold production for the year to come in mostly in-line with estimated 2011 production levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Troubled Sears Holdings (SHLD +11.3%) is shooting higher in early trading, apparently due to...

    Troubled Sears Holdings (SHLD +11.3%) is shooting higher in early trading, apparently due to speculation that it will be taken private.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • RRD

    R.R. Donnelley (RRD -13.7%) shares sink to a 52-week low after saying it's unable to provide...

    R.R. Donnelley (RRD -13.7%) shares sink to a 52-week low after saying it's unable to provide GAAP earnings estimates for FY2011 because it is still determining "a pension curtailment gain, acquisition-related expenses and other items." The printing company did put full-year revenue at $10.6B, below $10.72B consensus; it sees free cash flow above previous estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • NEE

    The continuing decline in natural gas (off 6.9% today) and resultant fall in electricity prices...

    The continuing decline in natural gas (off 6.9% today) and resultant fall in electricity prices is shelving alternative energy projects from NextEra (NYSE:NEE), Exelon (NYSE:EXC), and CMS, but Michael Morris of American Electric Power (NYSE:AEP) warns about becoming too dependent on gas. "The way to make $4 gas, $8 gas is for everyone to go out and build ... natural-gas plants."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 5 Comments
  • JBLU

    JetBlue (JBLU -5%) takes a hit after Dahlman Rose downgrades the stock to Sell and cuts its 2012...

    JetBlue (JBLU -5%) takes a hit after Dahlman Rose downgrades the stock to Sell and cuts its 2012 earnings view by 22%, saying valuation remains pricey and the potential exists for underperforming passenger unit-revenue growth in 2012. Better options might be Southwest (LUV +1.2%) or Alaska Air (ALK +0.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • PBTH

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH +11.1%) follows up last week's strong gains with a double-digit move up....

    Prolor Biotech (PBTH +11.1%) follows up last week's strong gains with a double-digit move up. M.E. Garza attributes the buying to M&A chatter emerging out of a major healthcare conference last week in San Francisco on the strength of the firm's promising drug pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +17.4%) is ripe for a buying opportunity after Friday's stock rout following...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +17.4%) is ripe for a buying opportunity after Friday's stock rout following the departure of two senior engineers, at least two analysts say. Goldman upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral, arguing Friday's selloff was overdone, and J.P. Morgan believes "the Model S is too far along in its development for these events to cause any major delay/quality issues."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARQL

    Shares of ArQule (ARQL +14.2%) roar to life after the firm announces that its Tivantinib liver...

    Shares of ArQule (ARQL +14.2%) roar to life after the firm announces that its Tivantinib liver cancer drug met its primary endpoint in Phase II clinical trials.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • HAS

    Hasbro (HAS +1.1%) reverses course and is now trading in the green this morning, despite an...

    Hasbro (HAS +1.1%) reverses course and is now trading in the green this morning, despite an early pre-market dip after saying it expects to report Q4 revenue below analyst estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • DWA

    Drewamworks (DWA -2.1%) is missing out on today's rally after Goldman downgrades shares to Sell,...

    Drewamworks (DWA -2.1%) is missing out on today's rally after Goldman downgrades shares to Sell, and lowers its PT to $15. The firm is worried about preliminary data indicating Q4 DVD sales of Kung Fu Panda 2 were 30% below its prior forecast, as well as weak box office revenue for Puss in Boots. Moreover, Goldman sees the former as indicative of a "secular shift" in DVD demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (KGC -16.2%) tumbles after forecasting its 2012 production will increase only...

    Kinross Gold (KGC -16.2%) tumbles after forecasting its 2012 production will increase only modestly in 2012, to 2.6M-2.8M gold equivalent ounces from 2011's 2.6M, and its production costs will rise to $670-$715/ounce from ~$600/ounce. Kinross also forecasts its 2012 capex will be roughly $2.5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • DSSMY

    DS Smith (OTC:DSSMY) agrees to buy the recycled packaging ops of Sweden's SCA (OTCPK:SVCBY) for...

    DS Smith (OTC:DSSMY) agrees to buy the recycled packaging ops of Sweden's SCA (OTCPK:SVCBY) for €1.6B ($2B) as it looks to win more business from the world's major consumer goods firms, including P&G, Nestle, Kraft and Unilever. SCA +11.4% on the OTC, DS Smith +4.4% in London. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • CPWR

    Compuware (CPWR -8.5%) trades sharply lower after reporting disappointing preliminary FQ3...

    Compuware (CPWR -8.5%) trades sharply lower after reporting disappointing preliminary FQ3 revenue, below the estimate of analysts. The firm now sees FY12 EPS falling in a range of $0.40-$0.42, below the consensus mark of $0.47.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • MNK

    Questcor (QCOR +7%) rebounds after it responds to last week's negative report which questioned...

    Questcor (QCOR +7%) rebounds after it responds to last week's negative report which questioned its "aggressive" marketing and business practices. Jefferies believes the allegations likely have little substance and wonders why StreetSweeper covered nearly half its 80K short position before issuing its report; it keeps a Buy rating on the shares with a $50 target.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM

  • The euro dives from the day's highs as a couple of comments hit the tape. Dutch finmin Jan Kees...

    The euro dives from the day's highs as a couple of comments hit the tape. Dutch finmin Jan Kees de Jager says no more aid should go to Greece if its debt is unsustainable, and it's up to the IMF to decide such. Meantime, Swiss economy minister Schneider muses about a eurozone with Germany, the Netherlands, and France.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • VQ

    Premarket gainers: VQ +50%. CNVO +48%. DNN +17%. PVX +15%. TSLA +15%. ISTA +11%. EK +10%. ING...

    Premarket gainers: VQ +50%. CNVO +48%. DNN +17%. PVX +15%. TSLA +15%. ISTA +11%. EK +10%. ING +8%. AEG +8%. FRO +8%. AVL +7%. QCOR +7%. BRD +6%. NBG +6%. RBS +6%. NOK +6%. TTM +5%. JASO +5%. MTL +4%. BHP +4%. SINA +4%. RIO +4%. ASML +4%. HMA +4%. WFR +4%. GMCR +3%. TSL +3%. HL +3%. AVNR +3%. HMY +3%. NDCO +3%. CLWR +3%. BIDU +3%. TOT +3%. BSBR +3%. BUD +3%. FCX +3%. CS +3%.
    Losers: CUK -16%. CCL -15%. KGC -8%. RCL -7%. C -5%. MTG -5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM

    Morgan Stanley moves up its rating on Panera Bread (NASDAQ:PNRA) to Overweight from Neutral with...
